title: Ticket #6060: Negotiator metrics
description:
CMS still has a difficult time debugging negotiator issues. Things that appear simple - "do we have too many RRLs or are we spending too much time on network IO" - are frustrating hard.

A few brainstorming ideas for negotiator metrics:

  • Keep a count of "repeat offenders": keep a history of the slots matched in the last N negotiation cycles (N=2?). Print out the counts of slots that have been matched more than once within the window. This would allow us to detect startds that are not claimable.
  • Report prefetching time (in total) as a standalone metric.
  • Differentiate between "CPU usage" and "IO usage" when recording time spent interacting with schedds. For example, this could be done by adding a getrusage call and recording the increases in ru_utime.
  • Report the number of RRLs received per-schedd per negotiation cycle. Note this is different from #4611. Alternate is to have a schedd-side count of the RRLs in memory.
  • Report fine-grained statistics (timings per schedd) to the negotiator ad.
remarks:
2017-Mar-02 14:01:26 by jfrey:
I've added the following new negotiator statistics:

  • LastNegotiationCyclePies: Number of pies that were spun (will be greater than 1 for hierarchical group quotas)
  • LastNegotiationCyclePieSpins: Number of spins across all pies
  • LastNegotiationCyclePrefetchDuration: Time spent in schedd prefetch
  • LastNegotiationCycleCpuTime, LastNegotiationCyclePhase1CpuTime, LastNegotiationCyclePhase2CpuTime, LastNegotiationCyclePhase3CpuTime, LastNegotiationCyclePhase4CpuTime, LastNegotiationCyclePrefetchCpuTime: Companions to duration stats that record cpu time (increase in user time from getrusage())
  • LastNegotiationCycleScheddsOutOfTime: Set of schedds that exceeded per-schedd time limit
